meanings.definition: A person or thing that bottoms.
meanings.sent1: The bottomer picked up the fallen book.
meanings.sent2: The little bottomer found a shiny rock on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The bottomer tried to reach the cookie jar on the top shelf.
meanings.sent4: In the game of musical chairs, the bottomer was always the last one standing.
meanings.sent5: The bottomer in the group was known for always being helpful and kind.

meanings.sent1: The bottomer in the team scored the winning goal.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the best bottomer in the dance class.
meanings.sent3: The bottomer at the party was the first to finish the cake.
meanings.sent4: As a bottomer, he always supported his friends through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The bottomer in the group had a contagious smile that brightened everyone's day.

meanings.sent1: She decided to bottom the shelf with the heavy books.
meanings.sent2: The workers had to bottom the hole before starting construction.
meanings.sent3: He tried to bottom the puzzle, but some pieces were missing.
meanings.sent4: The team had to bottom the mountain to reach the hidden cave.
meanings.sent5: In order to fix the leak, they had to bottom the pipe carefully.
